title: Bill Clinton Hangs Out with BeyoncÃ© on Her Birthday
title_page: Bill Clinton Hangs Out with BeyoncÃ© on Her Birthday | Breitbart
text:
BeyoncÃ© got quite the birthday present on Sunday in Philadelphia â€” namely, the chance to hang out with former president Bill Clinton.
The Lemonade superstar and the 42nd president of the United States were spotted chatting backstage at the Made in America music festival, which was founded by BeyoncÃ©â€™s husband, Jay Z.
Jay Z, Bill Clinton, and BeyoncÃ©. ğŸ˜ pic.twitter.com/RjrrmvzHmS â€” Adam Smith (@AdamSmith_usa) September 5, 2016
In addition to BeyoncÃ© â€” who celebrated her 35th birthday at the festival on Sunday â€” Clinton was also snapped talking to Jay Z, Chance the Rapper and Travis Scott in the festivalâ€™s VIP lounge.
jay, chance + bill clinton backstage at #madeinamerica today pic.twitter.com/VM0NEgtJ6O â€” the lyfe (@OOTLYFE) September 5, 2016
Bill Clinton âœ–ï¸ Travis Scott pic.twitter.com/hWpXIsfBse â€” The Daily Dose (@dailydose) September 5, 2016
According to People, Clinton made the â€œimpromptuâ€ visit to the music festival to thank volunteers for registering Pennsylvania voters at the event and for helping to work on Hillary Clintonâ€™s presidential campaign.
Clinton also reportedly hung around at the festival to watch Chance the Rapperâ€™s performance.
BeyoncÃ© has long supported Hillary Clintonâ€™s presidential run; in May, the singer attended a fundraiser for the Democratic candidate at music mogul L.A. Reidâ€™s house. Both the singer and Hillary Clinton were also reportedly included on the A-list guest list for President Obamaâ€™s birthday party at the White House earlier this summer.
BeyoncÃ© got her own birthday shout-out at the festival Sunday as Chance the Rapper led the audience in a â€œHappy Birthdayâ€ sing-along.
BeyoncÃ©'s reaction to Chance the Rapper singing 'Happy Birthday' to her at the #MadeInAmerica festival pic.twitter.com/VhZp0druP9 â€” Music News & Facts (@musicnews_facts) September 5, 2016
The two-day Made in America Festival â€” now in its fifth year â€” saw performances from headliners Rihanna and Coldplay and from other big-name music acts including 2 Chainz and Lil Wayne, Edward Sharpe and the Magnetic Zeros, Gary Clark Jr. and DJ Khaled.
